data.title: Poison Belt by Conan Doyle, First Edition
data.meta_description: Lost World & the Poison Belt by Doyle, Sir Arthur Conan and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Softcover. Condition: Good. First Edition. Summoned by their eccentric friend Professor Challenger, Edward Malone, Professor Summerlee, and Lord John Ruxton travel to Challenger's country estate, bringing with themat the behest of their hostseveral canisters of oxygen. As the journey progresses, Malone recounts tales of strange goings on around the world and the behavior of all three men grows increasingly erratic. Reaching a pinnacle of bafflement, they arrive at the house of the outlandish Professor and are regaled with an eccentric theory involving their experiences and an apparent impending apocalypse. A dramatic departure from Conan Doyle's well-loved detective fiction, this is an engaging work of science fiction that provides a valuable glimpse of the author's incredible creative range.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. First Thus. A 1st thus (Berkley Medallion F-1203) of a collection of Doyle's Professor Challenger stories. "Professor Challenger imperiously summons his three best friends to come to his country house, each one to bring a cylinder of pure oxygen. When they arrive, the reason for this strange request becomes terrifyingly clear." Light edge wear. Little finger tip sized sticker scrape to the rear cover. Slight spine roll. Browning to the inside of the covers and light browning to the pages. A very good copy.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. First Thus. A 1st thus (Berkley Medallion F-1203) of a collection of Doyle's Professor Challenger stories. "Professor Challenger imperiously summons his three best friends to come to his country house, each one to bring a cylinder of pure oxygen. When they arrive, the reason for this strange request becomes terrifyingly clear." Light edge wear. A couple of very small scrape spots to the rear cover. Browning to the inside of the covers and light browning to the pages. A very good copy.

Hardcover. Condition: Fair. 1st Edition. THE POISON BELT, BEING AN ACCOUNT OF ANOTHER ADVENTURE OF PROF. GEORGE E. CHALLENGER, LORD JOHN ROXTON, PROF. SUMMERLEE, AND MR. E. D. MALONE, THE DISCOVERERS OF "THE LOST WORLD", BY ARTHUR CONAN DOYLE. 1ST EDITION 1913, I AM SATISFIED THIS IS THE 1ST CANADIAN EDITION OF WHICH ONLY 1000 WERE PUBLISHED. PROFESSIONALLY REBOUND HARDBACK. ONLY 7 OF 16 PLATES ARE PRESENT, ILLUSTRATED BY HARRY ROUNTREE. BOTTOM HALF OF TITLE PAGE MISSING BUT REPAIRED. BOTTOM HALF OF LAST PAGE MISSING BUT REPAIRED. PAGES 15 & 16 MISSING. A RARE EDITION WORTH REBOUNDING DESPITE FAULTS 199 PAGES.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. 1st Edition. Very good, Stated first printing (USA), first edition thus, blue cloth with white silk screened design on front cover and white font on spine. 158 pps Ex lib with several library stamps, residue of due date plate, and that ubiquitous pouch pasted on REP. Seems that dust jacket has been cut up wiht front flap including the price pasted down on FEP and rear flap pasted on REP. (Someone should be arrested for this:)) Otherwise, no writing. Corners bumped, acceptable reading copy with charming illustrations.

Hardcover. Condition: As New. Dust Jacket Condition: As New. First Thus. 187 SLIP-CASED pages. Above note about jacket, might better read - slipcase. Gary K. Wolfe provides the introduction and Harry Robins - the b/w illustrations. Read more about : Sumatra, Summerlee, permission, railway carriage, Indian rajah, Jarvis Brook, and Rotherfield. Boards are blue with a grey spine band. White end-papers. The Heritage promo brochure - laid on - tells us this work first appeared in 1913. Volume is beurtifully crispy, tight and bright. No names nor marks. Giftable !! QUote (p. 94) : " `My dear, the passengers on that train were no more animate than the coals into which they crashed or the carbon which they have now become.' said Challenger, stroking her hand soothingly. ` It was a train of the living when it left ._._._. ." Size: Octavo.

Soft cover. Condition: Fine. uncredited (illustrator). 1st Edition. First paperback edition/printing thus! 1966 Berkley F1203 with (new) uncredited cover art. Fine, unread and collectible condition - a very, very short tear at top front cover and age toning of the spine. Includes essays by both John Dickson Carr and Harlow Shapley - uncommon in nice condition. Another (eg. The Lost World!) masterful SF tale by Doyle proving there is much more than just Sherlock Holmes in his writing.

Paperback. Condition: Very Good. First Printing - First Thus. 158 pp. Berkley Book F1203. Lightly rubbed on the corners with an uncreased spine; some ink marks on the title-list page. This collection contains: Introduction: The Many-Sided Conan Doyle by John Dickson Carr; The Poison Belt; The Disintegration Machine; and When the World Screamed. Book.

Hardcover. First edition (same date on title and copyright pages with no additional printings listed). English revision of 1972. Black simulated(? ) morocco leather, gold lettering, all edges red, 3 7/8 x 5 5/8 inches, viii + 465 pp, index, illustrated with frontispiece. Hardcover, near fine. Some of the lettering rubbed and dulled, upper corner of one leaf creased, otherwise tight, clean, paper crisp, unmarked and apparently never read. Religion; Roman Catholic.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. 1st thus, 8vo. size, 187 pp. Part of Easton Press' Masterpieces of Science Fiction. Bound in full chocolate leather with cover and spine designs and titles in gold, hubbed spine, all edges gilt. With a full-color, full-page illustration opposite the title page, and a number of full-page b&W illustrations, by Harry Robins. There is a single small pen mark on the half-title, and a very small smoothed fold on the page's bottom corner, otherwise the book is essentially as-new, no flaws, with a binding so tight pictures were difficult to take. The typically handsome Easton Press production.

Hardcover. Condition: Fair. No Jacket. 1st Edition. First Edition With 1913 On The Copyright Page. Bound In Dark Red Cloth Over Boards With Gilt Lettering On The Front And Spine. Dirt Soiling Of The Cover And Top Edges. Front Hinge Starting And The Back Hinge Close To Separation. The Frontispiece And The First Illustration Are Missing. No Ownership Information Present.
